group_1.textLeft: All right, I'm going to begin the adjustment.@Just relax...

group_1.narration: It's not the first time I've had an adjustment like this,@but I'm still not used to it.
Every time she peers into my Soul Gem,@she looks beneath the mask I'm wearing@and sees the real me.

On the surface,@I'm an honor student who is beloved by everyone@and the daughter of a well-off family, but underneath,@I'm the eldest daughter of a poor family@who is constantly working part-time jobs.
I'm the one who created such a troublesome facade,@but it's my family and my circumstances that@led to it in the first place.
My father is a kind and generous man,@but he's always trusting people and getting cheated,@so he's always running up debts.
My mother is a gentle woman,@but she's a bit careless,@which is why she's always been the victim of@some nasty scams and strange solicitors.
Since both of them are overly optimistic@and have little sense of danger,@I have to be strong to protect my family.
To be honest, I wish my parents@would get their act together. But I think@there's something wrong with this absurd world@that benefits the people who cheat them.
So I decided to fight against it,@to protect my family,@and to rise up so that one day@I could make it easier for my poor, kind parents.
And now I'm pretending to be a@daughter of a well-off family,@trying to make connections with@proper young ladies to become rich.
I know it's inconvenient to pretend to be@something I'm not, but I know that@poor people are never respected.

Many will look at homeless people in this town@and assume they ended up like that because@they were lazy, because they wasted their life,@or that they must have deserved it anyway,@and just carry on without lending a hand.
Yes...@When you're going through tough times,@you can't always count on the@people around you to help you.
...That's why I decided to@rely on my own strength instead of others.@I wouldn't need real friends anymore.@I wouldn't even need my own peace of mind.
The only one I can trust is myself...@You can't protect anything with@a half-hearted attitude.

group_1.textLeft: It's done.
...Aren't you pushing yourself a little too hard?

group_1.textRight: If you "saw" me, you'd know...@This is who I am.
...Even though it can't be helped,@it's still unpleasant being seen.

group_1.textLeft: I'm sorry about that...
But I'll keep your secret, so don't worry,@okay?

group_1.textRight: ...Well, I somewhat trust you, since@I've yet to be exposed.

group_1.textLeft: *Giggle* Thank you.

group_1.textRight: ...Also, you suddenly called me in for@my next adjustment out of the blue.
What did you want from me?

group_1.textLeft: Ah, yes, about that...

group_1.narration: "Have you heard of the@'Rumor of the Impersonator Magical Girl'?"

group_1.textLeft: It's exactly what it sounds like.
Apparently, there's an impostor of you@out there, Sae.
No one would want an impostor of themselves@doing whatever they please.
But for you, who spends your time at school@masquerading as a daughter of a well-off family...
I'm sure it's a matter of life and death.
So here's my suggestion.
You've been making friends with others@recently, so...
Why don't you seek help from Emiri's@counseling room?
There are girls from all over, so they should be@familiar with what's happening across Kamihama.
And they're all very kind, so I'm sure@they'll help you out.

group_1.textRight: We're not friends... That's only on the surface.

group_1.textLeft: ...I think you can still be friends with them,@even if you don't reveal your true self.

group_1.textRight: ...Thank you once again for the information.

group_1.textLeft: It's okay, there's still time before classes start.
Besides, I wouldn't have time to come after@school. There are children for me to look after...

group_1.textCenter: Her hard-working spirit is one of her@best qualities, but...
